intro: Gossypium sericatum, commonly known as the silky cotton or desert cotton, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the deserts of North America and is characterized by its soft, silky fibers that are used in textile production. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it produces capsules that contain the fibrous seeds. Gossypium sericatum is valued for its historical and economic significance in the textile industry.
